addons.name: Rebrand
addons.description: This wizard creates an XPI that rebrands Firefox, SeaMonkey or Thunderbird. You can change the brand name as well as the brand images and icons.
addons.fullDescription:
DISCLAIMER

This extension is intended for two purposes: entertainment and redistributing Firefox, SeaMonkey or Thunderbird within your organization.

Under no circumstances should this extension be bundled with Firefox or Thunderbird and delivered to another individual unless that individual is within your organization.

If you want more information, you can consult the Mozilla Foundation Trademark Policy at http://www.mozilla.org/foundation/trademarks/

In addition, it should be noted that this extension does not completely rebrand on Mac. The application title in the menu bar cannot be changed from an extension.

If you have a specific need to rebrand Firefox or Thunderbird and ship it (including Mac), please contact Kaply Consulting at http://consulting.kaply.com. We specialize in that.

addons.name: Greasemonkey
addons.description: Customize the way a web page displays or behaves, by using small bits of JavaScript.
addons.fullDescription:
Allows you to customize the way a web page displays or behaves, by using small bits of JavaScript.

You can write your own scripts, too. Check out http://wiki.greasespot.net/ to get started. Many scripts already exist, probably ones to enhance your favorite sites. Find them at http://wiki.greasespot.net/User_Script_Hosting .


Having trouble? Please don't post comments here, nobody will see them. If you need help, please read:
http://wiki.greasespot.net/Greasemonkey_Manual:Getting_Help

screenshots.caption: Script management is integrated with the Firefox Add-Ons Manager dialog.

addons.name: Hide Tab Bar With One Tab
addons.description: Hide the tab bar if there is only one tab.
addons.fullDescription: Hide the tab bar if there is only one tab. I don't know why Mozilla changed their code to show the title bar if tabs are not there in version 29 and above. So far I do not see an easy way to change it, but you only lose about 5 pixels verse if it was hidden. It's probably more useful that way anyway since you get the title of the page you are on.

addons.name: Menu Icons Plus
addons.description: Adds icons to your Firefox menus. Choose from the built-in icon sets or import your own.
addons.fullDescription:
Menu Icons Plus iconifies your Firefox menus and more. It includes built-in icons sets to choose from, along with the ability to import/export icon sets. It also provides options for changing other aspects of the menus' appearance. View the screenshots to see what other options are included.

How to use Menu Icons Plus:

Once it is installed, start Firefox and open the Add-ons Manager from the App menu or Tools menu.
Select Menu Icons Plus and click the Options button (or Preferences button in Linux).
Here you can change which icon set to use for the menu icons, and set different preferences for how the menus appear.
Click the OK button (or Close button in Linux); if your changes don't take effect right away, restarting Firefox should do the trick.

***PLEASE NOTE***
Some options may be incompatible with Firefox themes that deviate from the standard theme in significant ways.

Known issues:
-Menu Icons Plus is not compatible with the CuteMenus or CuteButtons add-ons.

screenshots.caption: Firefox menu with Fugue icons on Windows 7
Context menu with Tango icons in Ubuntu Linux
File menu with Crystal Project icons on Windows 7

addons.name: Menu Editor
addons.description:
Customize application menus:

Rearrange or remove menuitems from the main context menu (right-click menu) and main menubar (File Edit View etc.)
addons.fullDescription:
Rearrange or remove menuitems from the main context menu (right-click menu) and main menubar (File Edit View etc.).

CTRL+SHIFT+S brings up the Menu Editor Options dialog.
